      • suspendAllCounting

        public void suspendAllCounting()
        Description copied from interface: CountersInterface
        Suspends counting on ALL counters until counting is resumed with resumeAllCounting. Counters already suspended prior to this call will not resume counting due to a call to resumeAllCounting. You must use resumeCounter to resume counting for these.
        Specified by:
        suspendAllCounting in interface CountersInterface
        See Also:
        CountersInterface.suspendAllCounting()

      • resumeCounter

        public void resumeCounter(UniqueIDInterface counter)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: CountersInterface
        Resume counting on a single counter suspended by suspendCounter. Counting will not resume if suspendAllCounters is still "active". In this case, counting will resume once resumeAllCounting has been called.
        Specified by:
        resumeCounter in interface CountersInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        CountersInterface.resumeCounter(UniqueIDInterface)

      • resumeAllCounting

        public void resumeAllCounting()
        Description copied from interface: CountersInterface
        Resumes counting suspended by suspendAllCounting. Counters specifically suspended by suspendCounter are NOT resumed. You must use resumeCounter to resume counting for these.
        Specified by:
        resumeAllCounting in interface CountersInterface
        See Also:
        CountersInterface.resumeAllCounting()

        Description copied from interface: GenericToolsInterface

        Specified by:

        See Also:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from interface: GenericToolsInterface
        Reset or clear any cached information in the underlying tool or service. The implementation should be able to recognize if the underlying tool or service is not actually running. If the tool is not running, then this should exit gracefully without adversely affecting anything.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface GenericToolsInterface
        See Also:
        GenericToolsInterface#reset()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: GenericToolsInterface
        Shutdown the underlying tool or service. The implementation should be able to recognize if the underlying tool or service is not actually running. If the tool is not running, then this should exit gracefully without adversely affecting anything.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface GenericToolsInterface
        See Also:
        GenericToolsInterface#shutdown()

      • setCounterMode

        public void setCounterMode(UniqueIDInterface counter,
                           long mode)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: CountersInterface
        Set a counter's mode. mode==1: count everything (default). mode==2: count only STEP level results.
        Specified by:
        setCounterMode in interface CountersInterface
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        See Also:
        CountersInterface.setCounterMode(UniqueIDInterface,long)

                               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Description copied from interface: GenericToolsInterface

        Specified by:
        getCoreInterface in interface GenericToolsInterface

        CoreInterface instance.
